content.description: Start at the left bottom corner of formation off the boulder. Consider clipping the 1st bolt from the ground so you don't end up in the abyss. Climb past 7 more bolts on good (if slightly mossy) rock. This route should clean up nicely with a few repeats. The upper section eases up on difficultly on patina plates on the way to a 2 bolt anchor at top.
content.location: Follow trail from Meatloaf cave to climb at lower left of formation

content.description: Start on the upper tier, up and right of "Made to Order".  It's wise to clip the 1st bolt from the ground to avoid a fall into the abyss. Follow 5 more bolts to 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Up and right of "Made to Order"

climbs.name: Black Sheep
climbs.fa: Darren Odgers, Mike Forest, & Tony Becchio  3/30/15

content.description:
Climb the slab/face to the 2nd bolt, go right, across the seam

to gain access to the fun discontinuous flakes/cracks getting to the

last flake, feels like the crux to me. Then go straight up the slab, a little run-out, but easy climbing on solid jugs. Clip the last bolt, then mount the head-block ( exciting! ) to gain the

anchor. Still alot of lichen on the bottom section, but should clean-up with traffic. Fun!, bring an

extra rope or use a 70 m. to rappel
content.location:
Farthest left side of cliff, 15 ft. left of " Made to order "

Start off block on left side of hole/gully, since there is no

" real " base
